questions.explanation:
→ CLASS I BITES : No prophylaxisrequired.

  • Licks over intact skin

→ CLASS II BITES: Post exposure prophylaxisrequired.

  • Licks over broken skin
  • No oozing of Blood

→ CLASS III BITES : Post exposure prophylaxis+ Igs

  • Facial Bites
  • Constant oozing of blood
  • Untraceable animal after bite
  • Wild animals bites

CLASS I BITES : No prophylaxisrequired.

  • Licks over intact skin

1b. Cochleotoxic Kanamycin, Amikacin, Neomycin, Tobramycin

3. Loop Diuretics Dose dependent Ototoxicity Furosemide, Ethacrynic acid, bumetanide
4. Macrolides Erythromycin
5. Anti-Malarial Quinine, Chloroquine, hydroxychloroquine
6. NSAIDS Ibuprofen, Naproxen, Indomethacin
7. Chemicals Alcohol, Tobacco, Marijuana, Carbon Monoxide Poisoning
8. Miscellaneous Ampicillin, Propranolol, Propylthiouracil, Deferoxamine

Which of the following correctly represents the formula of Modified Shock Index?
questions.correct_answer: C. Heart rate / Mean arterial pressure
questions.explanation:
Shock index Modified shock index
  • Heart rate divided by Systolic BP
  • Better marker for assessing severity of shock than heart rate & BP alone
  • Utility in trauma patients, sepsis, obstetrics, myocardial infarction, stroke & other acute critical illnesses.
  • Correlated with need for interventions such as blood transfusion & invasive procedure including operations
  • SI is known as a hemodynamic stability indicator
  • SI does not take into account the diastolic BP
  • Heart rate divided by Mean arterial pressure
  • High MSI indicates a value of stroke volume & low systemic vascular resistance a sign of hypodynamic circulation
  • Low MSI indicates a hyper dynamic state
  • MSI has been considered a better marker than SI for mortality rate prediction

questions.text: A patient came to hospital after road traffic accident and was referred to ENT with complaints of watery nasal discharge on bending forward and is unable to sniff it back. Which of the following is false regarding this condition ?
questions.explanation:
CSF RHINORRHEA
  • Most common cause
 Head trauma
  • MC site
 # Cribriform plate of Ethmoid
  • Signs & Symptoms

Clear, watery discharge

↑ On coughing, sneezing, straining, bending forward(Tea pot sign)- Reservoir sign
  • CLINICAL

Sniff test:- Cannot sniff back

Handkerchief test:- Mucoid discharge will make it stiff.

Glucose test:- 2/3rd of blood glucose levels present in CSF (40 – 60 mg/dI)
  • IOC

HRCT

Gold standard investigation in CSF rhinorrhea??

  1. β2 transferrin levels (Not done because diagnose already done)
  2. HRCT of nose and PNS (To find site of leak) 1st inv./IOC
  3. MRI – T2 weighted images (Can’t see both # the CSF at once
  4. CT cisternography (Can see both #and the CSF)

In case of blood in CSF

  1. Halo sign / Target sign / double ring sign
  2. β2 Transferrin test (Gold std)Only found in CSF
MANAGEMENT
Traumatic Spontaneous CSF Rhinorrhea Paradoxical CSF Rhinorrhea

Conservative Management

Prophylactic Antibiotics (Wait for 7 days)

Acetazolamide

Stool softners & bed rest

REMEMBER

B/L anterior Nasal packing C/I (Causes meningitis)

No relief :- Lumbar drain for 2 wks

No relief :- Endoscopic repair

No injury

Causes - Brain tumor –

Do MRI for R/O cause of ICT

Repair (Endoscopic)

 # Temporal bone (Petrous part), can cause CSF otorrhea
  • Most common cause
 Head trauma
  • MC site
 # Cribriform plate of Ethmoid
  • Signs & Symptoms

Clear, watery discharge

↑ On coughing, sneezing, straining, bending forward(Tea pot sign)- Reservoir sign
  • CLINICAL

Sniff test:- Cannot sniff back

Handkerchief test:- Mucoid discharge will make it stiff.

  • IOC

HRCT

Gold standard investigation in CSF rhinorrhea??

  1. β2 transferrin levels (Not done because diagnose already done)
  2. HRCT of nose and PNS (To find site of leak) 1st inv./IOC
  3. MRI – T2 weighted images (Can’t see both # the CSF at once
  4. CT cisternography (Can see both #and the CSF)
Traumatic Spontaneous CSF Rhinorrhea Paradoxical CSF Rhinorrhea

Conservative Management

Prophylactic Antibiotics (Wait for 7 days)

Acetazolamide

Stool softners & bed rest

REMEMBER

B/L anterior Nasal packing C/I (Causes meningitis)

No relief :- Lumbar drain for 2 wks

No relief :- Endoscopic repair

No injury

Causes - Brain tumor –

Do MRI for R/O cause of ICT

Repair (Endoscopic)

 # Temporal bone (Petrous part), can cause CSF otorrhea

REMEMBER

questions.text: A 17 year old female underwent FNAC for a lump in the breast which was non-tender, firm and mobile. Histopathology reveals tightly arranged ductal epithelial cells with dyscohesive bare nuclei . What is the diagnosis ?
questions.explanation:
Phyllodes- leaf like appearance on cut section . Dual origin of mammary epithelium and connective tissue (stroma)

LCIS - Indian File Pattern

DCIS - may show cribriform , comedo or papillary growth patterns .

questions.text: 1. Match the homologous structure in males and females according to embryonic development. I. Bartholin’s gland a) prostate gland II. Labia majora b) gubernaculum III. Skene’s glands c) scrotum IV. Round ligament d) bulbourethral gland
questions.explanation:
Males females
Genital tubercle glans penis glans clitoris
Urogenital folds ventral aspect of penis and Penile urethra labia minora
Urogenital sinus prostate gland skene’s glands
Genital ridge testis ovary
Gubernaculum gubernaculum testis round ligament
Urogenital sinus bulbourethral glands Bartholin’s glands
Primordial germ cell spermatozoa ova
